```{r}

tick$Larval.Blood.Meal<-as.factor(tick$Larval.Blood.Meal)

library(magrittr)
library(tidyverse)
library(ggplot2)
theme_set(theme_bw()); theme_update(plot.title = element_text(hjust = 0.5))

setwd("~/Desktop/SFSU/Host_Legacy_GLM")
tick<-read.csv("Host_Blood_Meal_Data_Lisa+Kacie_AllData.csv", header=T)

liz<-subset(tick, Larval.Blood.Meal=="Scoc")
mouse<-subset(tick, Larval.Blood.Meal=="Pema")

Pema<-mouse$Infection.Status #mouse infection data
Scoc<-liz$Infection.Status  #liz infection data
  

# prepare a summary table with one row per experiment
tickplot<- tibble(
  host=factor(c( rep("Pema", length(Pema)), rep("Scoc", length(Scoc)))), 
  outcome=c(Pema, Scoc)) %>%
  group_by(host) %>% 
  summarize(n=n(), p=mean(as.numeric(as.character(outcome)))) %>%
  mutate(se=sqrt(abs(p*(1-p)/n)))



# visualizing with boxplot and 95% confidence intervals
ggplot(data=tickplot, aes(x=host, y=p, fill=host)) + 
  coord_cartesian(ylim=c(0,1)) + 
  geom_boxplot(
    stat='identity',
    aes(
      ymin=p-1.96*se, 
      lower = p - se,
      middle = p,
      upper = p + se,
      ymax = p + 1.96*se)
  ) + ylab("Proportion Infected")+
  ggtitle("Comparison of larval blood meal")



```
